WRITING.TITLE: I made my first gif today - hope you enjoy my burgers

WRITING.TEXT: [here is a making of gif :](http://i.imgur.com/wnWLtOt.gifv) http://i.imgur.com/wnWLtOt.gifv
it was my gfs idea to write "from the scratch" ... now i just hate myself :/
They were easy to made and tasted well but took over 2h to make it (the most of the time you have to wait).
Had to google for sloppy joes, I kind feel pain when I see these 'burgers'.
I guess you got me there...^^

red sauce (on the beef) : i made caramel and deglazed it with vinegar and worcestersauce added some ketchup and let it cook briefly and season with green pepper.
the white sauce (for the salad) : just mix mayonaise, rough-textured mustard, salt, vinegar, white pepper.
yeah but hey i made the bun !
http://smittenkitchen.com/blog/2009/07/light-brioche-burger-buns/
celsius?! or this strange measurement unit based on a very cold winter in england ? ;)
You're right had to throw it away :/

WRITING.TITLE: I made burgers from scratch for the first time today.

WRITING.TEXT: It was more or less improvised. But not that complicated at all: cook the sushi rice (add some sugar, rice vinegar, salt) and let it chill. Meanwhile cut all the other ingredients in little cubes and add a egg yolk. Then add the rice, form little balls (if you like put in the middle of some of them a little piece of feta cheese) and roll them in a mix of flour, starch and sesame und deepfry them until they have a nice colour.
Deepfried sushi rice balls with salmon, feta cheese,cucumber, parsley, chive, lime juice, lime zest, sojasauce, sugar, tomatoes, shallots, avocados and roasted sesame coating.

WRITING.TITLE: Quick Dinner for a summer night

WRITING.TEXT: true. dont feel too bad ;)
aprox 1 eggyolk 200g butter
3 h preperationtime
But look how pretty they are !
Well I do a lot of preperation before so I just have to put the things together. But of course you can't avoid a downtime completly, still worth it.

WRITING.TITLE: Six course menu for my girlfriend

WRITING.TEXT: thanks, its toast-bacon-egg-cupcakes, canapees with ham and roastbeef topped with Herbed Quark, croissants with different jams, shrimp cocktail with selfmade cocktail sauce and a sandwich with fried egg,ham,roastbeef,bacon, cream cheese, salad prosecco and an aperol cocktail
well its true it was too much, but i think i could only feed 3 other ppl ;)
